title: AB 250
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 2290.5 of the Business and Professions Code is amended to define terms related to telemedicine, including "asynchronous store and forward," "distant site," "health care provider," and "originating site." Telehealth is the delivery of healthcare services via technology to facilitate patient care, diagnosis, treatment, and education. It includes synchronous interactions between patients and providers at distant sites. Prior to delivering healthcare via telehealth, the provider must inform the patient, obtain consent, and document it. Patients can still receive in-person care if they agree to telehealth first. Non-compliance is considered unprofessional conduct. This section does not change a provider's scope of practice or allow unauthorized healthcare delivery. (f) Laws on health information confidentiality and patient rights apply to telehealth. (g) Excludes patients under Department of Corrections jurisdiction. (h) Hospitals can grant privileges to telehealth providers based on medical staff recommendations. The Legislature intends to authorize hospitals to grant privileges and verify credentials for telehealth providers. Telehealth includes telemedicine as defined in federal regulations. Applicants for licensure exams must complete 3,000 hours of experience over 104 weeks, with no more than 40 hours in a week and at least 1,700 hours supervised after obtaining a master's or doctoral degree. The applicant must have no more than 1,300 hours of supervised experience before completing a master's or doctoral degree, with a limit of 750 hours for counseling and direct supervisor contact. Experience cannot be gained before completing 12 semester units or 18 quarter units of graduate instruction, except for personal psychotherapy. Additionally, no experience can be gained more than six years before filing for examination eligibility, except for up to 500 hours gained in supervised practicum. The combined total of experience in direct supervisor contact cannot exceed 1,000 hours. Professional enrichment activities for marriage and family therapy applicants include workshops, seminars, training sessions, and conferences approved by their supervisor. They can also participate in personal psychotherapy for up to 100 hours, with credit for three hours of experience per hour. Additionally, applicants can have up to 500 hours of experience providing group therapy or counseling. For hours gained on or after January 1, 2012, applicants must have experience in administering psychological tests, client advocacy, diagnosing and treating couples, families, and children, and providing personal psychotherapy via telehealth. The total hours of experience should not exceed 500 for group therapy or counseling, 375 for personal psychotherapy or crisis counseling via telehealth. Applicants are encouraged to gain experience working with elders and dependent adults with limitations. This requirement applies to hours gained after January 1, 2010. The subdivision applies to hours gained after January 1, 2010. Applicants, trainees, and registrants must be supervised to ensure counseling aligns with their training. Supervised experience must be gained as an employee or volunteer, not as an independent contractor. Compliance with laws and regulations is the responsibility of the supervisor. An intern must provide W-2 forms or a verification letter from their employer when applying for licensure. Supervision for experience gained must include one hour of direct contact per week, with specific requirements for trainees. An individual supervised after obtaining a qualifying degree must receive additional direct supervisor contact for every week with more than 10 hours of client contact. No more than six hours of supervision can be credited in a single week. Direct supervisor contact can be face-to-face on an individual basis or in a group of up to eight supervisees for at least one continuous hour. An intern in certain settings can have weekly supervisor contact via video conferencing to ensure client confidentiality. All trainee experience must be monitored by the supervisor. Six hours of supervision per week can be credited starting from January 1, 2009. Trainees can receive credit for supervised experience in settings that provide mental health counseling or psychotherapy. An intern can gain supervised experience in settings that provide mental health counseling or psychotherapy, overseen by a qualified supervisor. The setting must not be a private practice owned by certain licensed professionals. An intern must receive oversight to ensure their work meets experience and supervision requirements in mental health counseling or psychotherapy settings. They cannot work in a private practice until registered, and fair remuneration is encouraged for interns. An intern in private practice must be directly supervised by a licensee meeting specific requirements, except during supervisor's absence. Experience must be gained within the intern's volunteering or employment position. Registration as an intern is necessary for postdegree supervised experience hours towards licensure. (g) Postdegree hours of experience credited towards licensure if intern registration applied for within 90 days of qualifying degree. Trainees, interns, and applicants cannot receive payment from patients and must be paid by employers. Trainees and interns must work at their employer's place of business under supervision, following laws and regulations. They can provide services via telehealth with licensed supervision. Trainees and interns cannot have a financial interest in their employer's business. Trainees, interns, or applicants receiving up to $500 per month for expenses incurred in lawful work settings are considered employees, not independent contractors. Applicants may be audited to prove expenses were legitimate. Each educational institution and supervisor should consider encouraging students, interns, and trainees to undergo counseling or psychotherapy as appropriate. Assistance in locating affordable counseling services should be provided if desired by the applicant.
